titles.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 493) to prohibit discrimination on the basis of genetic information with respect to health insurance and employment.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-612, by Ms. Slaughter.
The resolution makes in order a motion to agree to the Senate amendment to H.R. 493. The motion is debatable for one hour, equally divided and controlled.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 211.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1156.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by voice vote.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 4/29/2008--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 493) to prohibit discrimination on the basis of genetic information with respect to health insurance and employment.
